item.title: Report E-2024110335
item.description:
Report E-2024110335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) pounds of Devere Security Floor Treatment released from one (1) 55-gallon fiber drum. Personnel advised the release impacted the concrete at dock floor. Dayton Freight stated they cleaned up the release with oil dri absorbent. Personnel confirmed they completed cleanup and generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste. Dayton Freight explained that the impacted drum was repaired and will continue shipping to the receiver. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110315
item.description:
Report E-2024110315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 11, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1170 had a leak and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean the site. All impacted materials were collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal and the 275-gallon tote was staged for future shipment.
